channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cat litter with faeces, 5th February
item.description:
I am reporting repeated dumping of cat litter mixed with faeces on the public pavement outside our building. This has happened several times, including again this morning, always in the same spot. The spread look as it’s being thrown from an upper-floor..

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victorian Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe pothole causing large standing water/flooding on Oxford Mews (off Bexley High Street, DA5 1AD), outside the communal bin store/garage area., 5th February
item.description:
There is a large pothole/depression on Oxford Mews (off Bexley High Street, DA5 1AD) near the communal bin store/garage area, which fills with rainwater and creates a large pond across the roadway (see photo). This is a safety hazard: the water conceals the depth/edges of the pothole, creating a trip/slip risk for pedestrians and a risk of vehicle damage. It also makes it difficult to access the communal bin store and affects access for residents and potentially waste collection. The issue has been present for approximately 4 months and occurs whenever it rains. I have contacted the local council, who have indicated that this appears to be on a privately owned road. As the road provides essential access to the communal bin store serving the development, please confirm who is responsible for inspection and repair, and arrange an inspection and remedial works. If repair cannot be immediate, please implement temporary warning/mitigation (e.g., cones/signage, barriers, or temporary fill) to reduce the risk in the meantime.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Oxford Mews, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp post light still not working, 5th February
item.description:
8583377 - you said to notify you if not resolved after 4 weeks. It's been 4 weeks and the street lamp is still not working. It's dark and people cannot see where or what they are stepping in. It's a danger to those walking late at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Oak Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked road gully, 5th February
item.description:
This road gully on Sumner Road, just off the Peckham High street, has been blocked for months. There's usually a big pool of water as the water can't drain easily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Peckham High Street, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: By 37 Mill Ln, London NW6 1NB :Zebra Crossing, 5th February
item.description:
This is perennial problem. I reported it 2 years ago. A very serious hole in road has developed again on the zebra crossing. People who are local slow down to avoid damage to their vehicles, this dangerously holds up people who are not local and not expecting a vehicle to brake (if no people visible on or near zebra crossing). The hole is danger to vehicles and pedestrians You keep patching it up every year, poorly. It needs to be stripped and relayed properly. The hole is pehaps 30cm by 20 cm, directly on the zebra crossing, 70cm on the road from the curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Mill Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two dips in road surface, 5th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yester Road, Elmstead, Greater London
